attributes.action: Make estate agents stand by the prices they give in their free market appraisals when taking on more properties.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whatever valuation an agent originally gives should become the basis for a sale to that agent if they fail to sell the house within three months.

If the house in question fails to sell, the owner may then require the agent to buy it at their own valuation (less say 5% for admin costs) and, the agent would be required to complete the purchase within 1 month. This would take the marketing process to a maximum total of four months per property which is a sensible amount of time for vendors.
It would also encourage agents to keep ‘their pencils sharp’ when doing so-called ‘Free Market Appraisals’ instead of just bidding to secure more houses to sell.

To implement this all that is needed is an additional clause in the agency contract, setting out the agreed timescale for the agent to purchase.

Trading Standards would police this.

If asking prices were to be correctly pitched, the whole house market would start rolling once more. It really is that simple.

For more info see the Property Match Blog.
